definition: Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)

sentences.english: Newton and Leibniz invented calculus about the same time.
sentences.chinese: 牛顿和莱布尼兹几乎同时发明了微积分方法。

sentences.english: The policy adopted in this book is to disallow Leibnizian notation within the text.
sentences.chinese: 本书采用的办法是在正文中不用莱布尼兹记号。

sentences.english: Isaac Newton had a bitter feud with Leibniz.
sentences.chinese: 牛顿就曾与莱布尼兹成为冤家。

sentences.english: Indeed it was this analysis which led Newton and Leibnitz to the discovery of differential calculus.
sentences.chinese: 就是这样的分析使牛顿和莱布尼兹发明了微积分。

sentences.english: As for a calculus of rational thought: dream on Leibnitz.
sentences.chinese: 而对于推理思维，就继续莱布尼兹的梦想吧。

sentences.english: Rationalists are Descartes, Leibniz and Spinoza.
sentences.chinese: 理性主义者有笛卡尔，莱布尼兹和斯宾诺莎。

definition: Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Mikolaj Kopernik or Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543), Polish astronomer, mathematician and polymath
Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯
